title: Density Formula
text: Density is mass per unit volume, and the formula is $$p=\frac{m}{v}$$ where $$p$$ is the density, $$m$$ is the mass, and v is the volume occupied by the substance.

title: Identify the Density of Gasoline
text: The density of gasoline is approximately $$\frac{670kg}{m^3}$$, and convert the volume of gasoline from $$20.0Lto$$ cubic meters $$0.02m^3$$.

title: Substitute the Values and Solve for M
text: Rearrange the formula to solve for mass: $$m_g=p_g v_g=670\times0.02=$$? (in kg)

title: Calculate the Total Mass
text: The total mass of the full gas can is the sum of the mass of the can and the mass of the gasoline: $$m_{total}=m_c+m_g$$. What is the total mass in kg?

title: Calculate the Average Density
text: The average density is given by $$p_{total}=\frac{m_{total}}{v}=\frac{15.9}{0.02}=$$? in $$\frac{kg}{m^3}$$
